revised_title: The Nucleus Theory of the Atom
tldr: Sir Ernest Rutherford discusses the structure of the atom, proposing the nucleus theory, in which a central nucleus contains positive charge and most of the mass, surrounded by electrons. He explains how the scattering of alpha particles provides evidence for the intense electric fields within the atom and the dimensions of the nucleus. Rutherford also suggests that the atomic number may be the defining property of elements, with hydrogen having one charge, helium two, and so on.
